abstract: Microsoft continues to put pressure on Google with new search features, like improvements to its mapping service.
snippet: Microsoft continues to put pressure on Google with new search features, like improvements to its mapping service.
lead_paragraph: If you’re at all like me, then you find Web search pretty frustrating when it comes to figuring out the local weather forecast. You pop a city’s name into a search engine and get a list of a few different weather sites. Oddly enough, they often have quite different forecasts for the days to come.

abstract: IDC, a leading technology research firm, is trotting out its crystal ball. Among its tech predictions for 2010: Apple brings out a tablet computer, netbooks move upscale, and I.B.M. buys Juniper Networks.
snippet: IDC, a leading technology research firm, is trotting out its crystal ball. Among its tech predictions for 2010: Apple brings out a tablet computer, netbooks move upscale, and I.B.M. buys Juniper Networks.
lead_paragraph: Apple brings out an iPad digital tablet. Netbooks move upscale. And I.B.M. buys Juniper Networks.

headline.main: For 2010, IDC Predicts an Apple iPad and Battles in the Cloud

abstract: Hewlett-Packard’s new iPaq smartphone shows that the company still has a long way to go in the mobile market.
snippet: Hewlett-Packard’s new iPaq smartphone shows that the company still has a long way to go in the mobile market.
lead_paragraph: Lost in the smartphone advertising wars between Apple, Verizon Wireless AT&T and Google is the iPaq Glisten.

headline.main: With Latest iPaq, H.P. Is Still Phoning It In

abstract: Google caves. Or negotiates. Or tweaks its search of news content.
snippet: Google caves. Or negotiates. Or tweaks its search of news content.
lead_paragraph: Decoder was so busy watching the Comcast deal flow — billions in the balance! secret meetings on the golf course! another reason to complain about your cable company! — that Google’s decision to address the concerns of publishers by altering its First Click Free program went whooshing right by us on Wednesday.

headline.main: A Tweak in Google’s Relationship With Publishers

abstract: Google’s new domain name system has a rival questioning the search giant’s motives.
snippet: Google’s new domain name system has a rival questioning the search giant’s motives.
lead_paragraph: People typically lunge for metaphors when trying to describe the Internet’s Domain Name System, or D.N.S., so here’s mine: think of D.N.S. as one of those switchboard operators at the old Ma Bell telephone company. Each Internet service provider has its own bank of these operators, called D.N.S. servers. Type in a Web address — nytimes.com, for example — and the ISP’s operator looks up the numerical IP address of the site and connects the call.

headline.main: Pondering Google’s Move Into the D.N.S. Business
